1.text: And Jehovah will say to Moses, Yet one blow will I bring upon Pharaoh and upon Egypt; after this he will send you forth from here; when his sending forth to go, driving, he will drive you out from here.

2.text: Speak now in the ears of the people; they shall ask each from his friend, and a woman from her friend, vessels of silver and vessels of gold.

3.text: And Jehovah will give favor to the people in the eyes of the Egyptians: also the man Moses was exceedingly great in the land of Egypt, in the eyes of Pharaoh’s servants, and in the eyes of the people.

4.text: And Moses will say, Thus said Jehovah, About the middle of the night I will go forth into the midst of Egypt.

5.text: And every first-born in the land of Egypt shall die, from the first-born of Pharaoh sitting upon his throne, even to the first-born of the maid which is behind the two mill-stones; and every first-born of quadruped.

6.text: And a great cry was in all the land of Egypt, such as was not, and such shall not be added.

7.text: And against all the sons of Israel, a dog shall not sharpen his tongue, from man and even to cattle: so that ye shall know that Jehovah will separate between Egypt and between Israel.

8.text: And all these thy servants shall come down to me, and worship to me, saying, Go forth, thou, and all the people which are at thy feet: and after this I will go forth. And he will go forth from Pharaoh in the heat of anger.

9.text: And Jehovah will say to Moses, Pharaoh will not hear to you; so that my wonders be multiplied in the land of Egypt.

10.text: And Moses and Aaron did all these signs before Pharaoh; and Jehovah will bind fast Pharaoh’s heart, and he sent not forth the sons of Israel from his land.
